intro: Anemia phyllitidis var. fraxinifolia, commonly known as the fraxinifolia variety of the genus Anemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive foliage, featuring palmately lobed leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
